description: The function 'create_scatterplot' generates a scatter plot image, which is a graphical representation of a set of data points plotted on a Cartesian coordinate system. It is primarily used in data visualization for identifying trends, distributions, and patterns in the data.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Scatter Plot
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'create_scatterplot' function can generate scatter plot images. It accepts an instance of the ScatterPlot class as input, which includes properties such as title, x-axis label, y-axis label, and data points. The data points are a list of Point instances, each with x and y values. The function sets the limits for the axes based on the minimum and maximum values provided in the ScatterPlot instance. The scatter plot is saved as an image file in a specified destination folder. This function is useful in educational settings for teaching students about data visualization, correlation, and trend analysis.

details: title: The title of the scatter plot
x_axis.label: The label for the x-axis
y_axis.label: The label for the y-axis
points: A list of Point instances, each with x and y values
x_axis.min_value, x_axis.max_value: The minimum and maximum values for the x-axis
y_axis.min_value, y_axis.max_value: The minimum and maximum values for the y-axis
The x and y values of the points should be numeric
The minimum value for both axes should be less than the maximum value
The function generates a scatter plot with the data points plotted on a Cartesian coordinate system
The scatter plot includes a title, labels for both axes, and grid lines for better visualization
The position of the data points on the scatter plot is determined by the x and y values of each point

educational_standards.description: Identify whether or not a mathematical relation is a function.
For scatter plots of bivariate measurement data, identify patterns of clustering.
For scatter plots of bivariate measurement data, identify outliers.
For scatter plots of bivariate measurement data, identify whether there exists a positive, negative or no association, and whether there is a linear or nonlinear association.
